node.title: Experts attest to Madeley mum's mental impairment when she killed young daughters
node.alt: Two young sisters smile for the camera.
node.description: Both the defence and the prosecution in Perth mother Milka Djurasovic's trial agree she should not be found guilty of murdering her young girls Tiana and Mia, because she was not of sound mind at the time.
node.content:
["A Perth mother who killed her two young daughters should be found not guilty of murder because she was not of sound mind at the time, prosecution and defence lawyers\u00a0in the case have agreed.", "WARNING: This story contains content that some people may find distressing.", "Milka Djurasovic, 40, has been\u00a0on trial in the Supreme Court over the deaths of 10-year-old Mia and six-year-old Tiana at the family's home in the northern Perth suburb of Madeley in October 2019.", "Ms Djurasovic admitted she killed the girls, but it has been argued by the prosecution and the defence that she should not be held criminally responsible because at the time she was not of sound mind.", "", "
After taking her daughters' lives at home, Ms Djurasovic repeatedly tried to kill herself.(ABC News: Emily Piesse)
", "
Experts agree on mental\u00a0impairment
", "The only witnesses at the trial have been three forensic psychiatrists,\u00a0one for the prosecution and two for the defence, who examined all the material in the case and interviewed Ms Djurasovic.", "All three said it was their conclusion that at the time of the killings, Ms Djurasovic was suffering from \"a major depressive disorder, with psychotic features\".", "They said the mental impairment had deprived her of the capacity to know that she ought not do\u00a0what she did.", "One of the psychiatrists, Viki Pascu, testified this morning that while Ms Djurasovic did know what she was doing, she did it\u00a0because \"she knew she had to end the torment for her children and for herself\".", "\"In her reality, those actions were very well justified,\" Dr Pascu said.", "The court has heard Ms Djurasovic's mental health had been in decline for about a year before, and she had stopped eating, withdrawn\u00a0from her family and was suffering panic attacks.", "", "
Mia Djurasovic\u00a0struggled with her mother before she was killed.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "She told psychiatrists after the killings that around July or August 2019, she thought the only way to stop what she was feeling was to kill herself.", "However, she did not think she could leave her children behind because she was worried they would end up in state care, so she started thinking about killing them.", "
'Today's the day'
", "On the day of their deaths, she decided \"today's the day\" and put her plan into action.", "After taking her daughters' lives, she repeatedly tried to kill herself and was later\u00a0located in sand dunes at Whitfords Beach.", "She was arrested and charged with the murder of her daughters and has been in custody, either at a secure psychiatric facility or in Bandyup women's prison, ever since.", "The court has heard in the months before the killings, Ms Djurasovic had seen a psychiatrist and a psychologist, but Dr Pascu said she had managed to conceal the full extent of her mental illness.", "", "
The court heard\u00a0Tiana Djurasovic had wanted to go to school on the day she was killed by her mother.(Supplied)
", "\"She was aware she had these beliefs, but she was careful to conceal them because she did not want to challenged,\" she said.", "
Accused to face institution with either verdict
", "Dr Pascu said it was her opinion that Ms Durjasovic's attempts to take her own life after the killing were genuine but not successful because of her indecisiveness and the \"time pressures\" of her husband returning home.", "\"Because she is not a person who kills a person once a week, doing this to her two daughters, who she dearly loves, is a highly emotional event,\" she said.", "\"So after she managed to complete that part \u2026\u00a0it's almost like the emotional intensity \u2026 is\u00a0significantly reduced.\"", "In closing submissions, Ms Djurasovic's barrister, Mark Trowell QC, said the defence relied on the \"collective opinions of the psychiatrists\".", "", "
The killings sent shockwaves through to the northern Perth suburb.\u00a0(ABC News: Emily Piesse)
", "State prosecutor Justin Whalley SC\u00a0said he submitted that Justice Stephen Hall should find Ms Djurasovic \"not guilty of murder on account of unsoundness of mind\".", "\"Three highly respected, well-credentialed experts are in agreeance, she had a major depressive illness with psychotic features,\" he said.", "\"She was in such a state of mental impairment she was deprived of the capacity she ought not do the act.\"", "Mr Whalley said nothing should be read into the fact that trial had only taken a day and a half.", "\"The brevity of the submissions bear no relationship to the tragic scale of the case and the impact it's had on those affected by it,\" he told the court.", "Justice Stephe Hall, who presided over the trial without a jury, is scheduled to deliver his verdict next week.", "If Ms Djurasovic is found not guilty, she will be subject to a custody order which means she will be detained in a hospital, prison or other authorised facility until she is deemed well enough to be released.", "If she is found guilty of the murders, she faces a possible life jail term."]
